Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.  

You might find it more convenient to edit the wiki page using <code>editmoin</code> a command line utility for editing moinmoin wiki pages.  It is available as a package since Gutsy.  More information including an easier way to do this was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-bugsquad/2007-November/000666.html|mailed]]</nowiki> to the Bug Squad. 

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

During hug days you can also do <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day|5-A-Day]]</nowiki> for this one you can do the following in order to tag your work on the hug day:
 
* 5-a-day --add-tag hugday-20080911
* Add bugs to 5-a-day as usual 
* And when done with hug day run: 5-a-day --remove-tag hugday-20080911

More information about <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day#Tag|tags here]]</nowiki>.

=== Find the Right Package ===
Take a look at this wiki page for tips on discovering the correct package. <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/FindRightPackage|Bugs/FindRightPackage]]</nowiki> is an excellent resource for pinpointing a bug's source. 

=== 50 newest bugs that are Confirmed without a package ===
These bug reports are the classic ones without a package but they have been Confirmed theoretically because another user experienced the problem.  Since they are Confirmed we should work on assigning them to a package.  There are more than 100 of these and you can find them via this <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.searchtext=&orderby=-datecreated&search=Search&field.status%3Alist=Confirmed&field.importance=Undecided&field.assignee=&field.owner=&field.omit_dupes=on&field.has_patch=&field.has_no_package=on&start=0|Launchpad search]]</nowiki>.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Assign it to a package 
* '''For bonus hugs''' Test to see if the bug still exists with Intrepid
